Description: Roundel in tapestry, applied and sewn to an undyed wool plain weave; the centre part of the medallion is decorated with an horseman on a red background; the man wears a costume with small dots in beige and red (probably a non-Egyptian costume), his head has a yellow halo, he holds in his right hand a sceptre or stylised branch with flower at the end; the white horse is orientated to the left, the horse has a jewlled saddle and it jumps over a feline; on each side of the horseman are four stylised human figures, two are flying and have raised hands towards the man's heads (common attitude for the personification of Victory); the man could be a saint (Gabriel or Michael); the central scene is urrounded with a freize of stylised vegetal interlacing in yellow, green, red and dark blue wool on a beige background, and framed each side with a multi-coloured geometrical frieze; the medallion is sewn with oversewing; all edge of plain weave are ragged; plain weave: warp-undyed wool (S/44), weft-undyed wool (S/10); tapetry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S/14), weft-undyed linen (S/80), yellow, orange, pink, red, green, blue, dark blue wool (S/80); sewing: oversewing in undyed linen (S spun Z ply)
Curator's comments: textile sewn to modern beige textile
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
